title: How to Download and Set Up set.a.light 3D

steps.headline: To download the software (it has a two week free trial), go to their website and choose the version that you want.
steps.description: If you are a beginner, the most basic version will work. A professional might like all of the advantages that the set.a.light 3D Studio can offer.

steps.headline: After downloading it, go through the usual processes to install it.
If you have a place (or places) that you want to call your studio, then you can custom design one.
steps.description: If not, start out with whatever size seems appropriate for your uses. You have small, medium, and large to choose from. For the purposes of this article, a small room will be used.

steps.headline: Look at the various options that you have to choose from to get started.
steps.description: One of the first things that you will want to do is go to the Settings option.

steps.headline: Check the country.
steps.description: Right now, set.a.light 3D comes in three languages.

steps.headline: Make sure the measurements are appropriate for where you live and will be taking photographs.
steps.description: Your options are Metric or Imperial.

steps.headline: Choose the laser pointer and lens flare options.
steps.description: You will definitely want to have the laser pointer, however, because that will tell you where the lighting is pointed at, exactly.

steps.headline: Be sure to check the Quality Settings.
steps.description: How you set these will depend upon your machine. The higher the resolution of whatever you are choosing, while you will get a better idea of the final product, it will certainly slow down your computer. Experiment and determine what is best for your purposes.

steps.headline: Choose your crop factor.
steps.description: If you don't know what your camera is, then do a quick search on the internet to determine your crop factor. Search for something like, for example, Nikon D3100 crop factor.

steps.headline: Choose the appropriate ratio.
steps.description: You will see options like 3:2, 5:4, etc. A good one to start with is the 3:2 option.

steps.headline: Choose a lens.
steps.description: You want to use the lens that matches what you are shooting with.

text: To download the software (it has a two week free trial), go to their website and choose the version that you want. If you are a beginner, the most basic version will work. A professional might like all of the advantages that the set.a.light 3D Studio can offer. After downloading it, go through the usual processes to install it.  If you have a place (or places) that you want to call your studio, then you can custom design one. If not, start out with whatever size seems appropriate for your uses. You have small, medium, and large to choose from. For the purposes of this article, a small room will be used. Look at the various options that you have to choose from to get started. One of the first things that you will want to do is go to the Settings option. Check the country. Right now, set.a.light 3D comes in three languages. Make sure the measurements are appropriate for where you live and will be taking photographs. Your options are Metric or Imperial. Choose the laser pointer and lens flare options. You will definitely want to have the laser pointer, however, because that will tell you where the lighting is pointed at, exactly. Be sure to check the Quality Settings. How you set these will depend upon your machine. The higher the resolution of whatever you are choosing, while you will get a better idea of the final product, it will certainly slow down your computer. Experiment and determine what is best for your purposes. Choose your crop factor. If you don't know what your camera is, then do a quick search on the internet to determine your crop factor. Search for something like, for example, Nikon D3100 crop factor. Choose the appropriate ratio. You will see options like 3:2, 5:4, etc. A good one to start with is the 3:2 option. Choose a lens. You want to use the lens that matches what you are shooting with.
